image.altText: wide shots of a forum of people speaking.

props.synopsis: There's continued calls for the Tasmanian government to try to re-negotiate the state's AFL licence deal, amid a public forum over the proposed Macquarie Point stadium development.

title.children: Cost, location and benefits aired at public forum on Hobart stadium

image.altText: Arthur Pieman River sign

props.synopsis: A decade-long fight over four-wheel-driving in areas of Tasmania's north-west rich in Aboriginal cultural sites may not be over, despite the government releasing a new management strategy.

title.children: 4WD track plan released with Aboriginal groups warning fight not over

image.altText: A blond man wearing a rainbow flag around his neck smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Labor's Josh Dolega is the frontrunner to replace Anne Urquhart in the Senate, after Ms Urquhart made the switch to the lower house.

title.children: Union organiser the frontrunner to become Tasmania's newest senator

image.altText: Judge wig

props.synopsis: How would you sentence this "armed robber"? Would you lock her up, or after hearing her personal story, would you be more lenient? The public is being given the chance to pass judgement on this very "case".

title.children: If you had the chance to sentence a criminal, how hard would you go?

image.altText: Multiple packets of colourful pharmaceutical medicines.

props.synopsis: Subsidised training for pharmacists so they can treat more conditions has been announced by the Tasmanian government, but not all agree with the plan.

title.children: Pharmacist to be able to treat more conditions under state budget measure

image.altText: Wayne Yole holds a horse's bridle.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian harness racing trainer Wayne Yole has been banned from housing or training horses at his Sidmouth property in northern Tasmania, following a multi-agency inspection of the stables.

title.children: Tasmanian harness racing trainer banned from keeping, training horses on property

image.altText: A brown alpaca is embraced by a woman wearing orange hi-visibility workwear.

props.synopsis: An alpaca owner has alleged a rural supermarket breached discrimination laws by not allowing the animal into the store.

title.children: Violet the alpaca asked to leave store, now owner going to court

image.altText: Three individuals wearing casual outdoor clothing photographed from the shoulders up.

props.synopsis: Liberty Bell Bay employs more than 250 full-time workers, mostly from the George Town area. Locals say they are worried about the impact of job losses as the smelter announces it's limiting operations.

title.children: 'George Town struggles as it is': Smelter work pause worries locals

image.altText: Tottenham Hotspur's Rodrigo Bentancur and Son Heung-min celebrate with an embrace on the pitch

props.synopsis: Tottenham Hotspur have defeated Manchester United 1-0 to win the Europa League final, the club's first trophy since 2008. Follow live.

title.children: Postecoglou and Tottenham win Europa League, Spurs' first trophy in 17 years

image.altText: Governor Michele Bullock speaks to media during a press conference in Sydney, Tuesday, May 20, 2025.

props.synopsis: We explain the reasons for RBA governor Michele Bullock's change in plans around interest rates — and where the US fits in.

title.children: Trump could spark a global reckoning that may force interest rates higher

image.altText: A composite image of Sussan Ley Bridget McKenzie.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley's office says National Party Senator Bridget McKenzie made false claims during an appearance on 7.30.

title.children: 'Not correct': Ley's office texts 7.30 live to dispute McKenzie's Coalition split claims

image.altText: bars of handmade soap and some flowers

props.synopsis: On the surface, they seem like typical soap businesses. But to their audience, they are a tool for spreading hate.

title.children: The hidden links between wellness and white supremacy

image.altText: A group of politicians stand outside Queensland parliament.

props.synopsis: The Queensland government has expanded its flagship 'adult crime, adult time' laws, with juvenile offenders subject to harsher penalties for 20 new offences.

title.children: Premier tells UN 'I don't answer to you', youth justice laws expanded

image.altText: Intubated and in a coma

props.synopsis: An Australian tourist who was rushed to hospital after drinking a pina colada at a popular Fiji resort says she is convinced she was "poisoned" by tainted alcohol.

title.children: Susan had two sips of a pina colada. Hours later, she was in a coma

image.altText: Workers attempt to fix a broken down train near Strathfield

props.synopsis: The blank signs, "major disruptions" and panic on the platforms, it was an all too familiar scene for Sydney's commuters. So what caused the meltdown?

title.children: Why a problem on one train sent Sydney's rail network into meltdown

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump's face as he speak to someone out of frame

props.synopsis: Beijing has doubled down on its criticism of the US president's aerial defence plans a day after a major announcement at the White House.

title.children: Trump's 'Golden Dome' plan risks turning space into 'war zone', China says

image.altText: Photo of a cow eating.

props.synopsis: Biosecurity experts and pastoralists have come together in Darwin to wargame their defences to lumpy skin disease, which could halt Australia's beef exports overnight if it was to enter the country.

title.children: The fight against foreign diseases that could bring beef exports to a 'standstill'

image.altText: A truck carrying a wind turbine stuck under a bridge.

props.synopsis: The damage bill from a truck crash on a major Queensland highway is expected to run into the tens of millions of dollars, and some warn it could happen again unless upgrades are fast-tracked.

title.children: Damage bill expected to be 'tens of millions' after truck hits bridge

image.altText: Composite image of Nina Kennedy, Paul Burgess and Katie Moon.

props.synopsis: Paul Burgess, the former coach of gold medal-winning pole vaulter Nina Kennedy, links with her American rival, claiming he had to look overseas for jobs after being banned from the WAIS facilities following his resignation in the lead-up to the Paris Olympics.

title.children: Nina Kennedy's renowned pole vault coach links with her long-time rival

image.altText: A white woman standing in front of green foliage with windblown long brown hair wearing an aqua top

props.synopsis: Charlotte McConaghy's latest novel, Wild Dark Shore, is a propulsive literary thriller set in one of the world's most remote and rugged locations.

title.children: The 2017 flooding of the Global Seed Vault inspired this literary thriller

image.altText: man standing in front of tent with waikato draught and chiefs flags hanging in the background

props.synopsis: Last-resort flights are being offered to New Zealand nationals because it's "easier" sending them home where they can access government financial assistance and housing.

title.children: Centre offers homeless Kiwis in Australia one-way flights home

image.altText: Composite of Jelena and Damir Dokic

props.synopsis: Jelena Dokic has confirmed the death of her father and abuser Damir, saying "the loss of an estranged parent comes with a difficult and complicated grief".

title.children: Jelena Dokic announces death of estranged father and abuser Damir

image.altText: A tent on a river bank with a river in the background.

props.synopsis: A free camping program in Victoria plagued by ghost bookings and rubbish dumping is abandoned by the state government.

title.children: Ghost bookers bring axe down on Victoria's free-camping experiment

image.altText: A woman in a colourful patterned shirt stands on a beach next to a pile of tree limbs. We see her from behind.

props.synopsis: When her teenage son's mental health spiralled, a mother turned to the system for help — but it wasn't available when she needed it most.

title.children: Mother's search for help exposes cracks in regional mental health care

image.altText: F1 driver Charles Leclerc driving his Ferrari through the chicane at the Monaco Grand Prix

props.synopsis: The jewel in the crown of Formula 1 — the Monaco Grand Prix — will be held on the streets of Monte Carlo this Sunday.

title.children: Your guide to the F1 Monaco Grand Prix

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson's alleged internet records have been shown to jurors in her triple-murder trial, which show a death cap mushroom web page was visited more than a year before the fatal lunch.

title.children: Death cap mushroom web page visited a year before Patterson's fatal lunch

image.altText: A kelpie farm dog drinks from a water trough on a farm, surrounded by dry, barren paddocks.

props.synopsis: Flooding rain in parts of Australia and forecast local showers during the coming week are unlikely to help Victoria's drought-stricken regions in any significant way, the Bureau of Meteorology says.

title.children: Victoria is in a historic drought. Here's why the NSW deluge won't help

image.altText: Will Goodge raises his arms with a banner

props.synopsis: British runner William Goodge broke the record for completing a trans-Australia run by a whopping four days — but there are a handful of people in ultra-running who have questions.

title.children: A runner took 4 days off the trans-Australia record, but some have questions

image.altText: A home buyer looks at documents. In the foreground of the image is a model house and keys.

props.synopsis: The big banks have all cut their variable home loan rates, but not everyone will want to reduce their mortgage repayments. Savers are still in the dark, with only two lenders announcing cuts to savings rates. Here's your handy guide to what the RBA cut means for you.

title.children: Which banks have passed on the rate cut? Which ones haven't?

image.altText: A man in a black T-shirt affectionately holds his one-eyed cat under the chin

props.synopsis: Michael thought he would have to surrender his beloved cat when he was suddenly hit with a big emergency vet bill. Experts say many Australians are taking on debts through high-interest loan schemes or making the heartbreaking decision to euthanise their pets.

title.children: Debt, death or surrender: The impossible choice faced by cash-strapped pet owners

image.altText: Chris brown on stage wearing a red jumper

props.synopsis: Brown has been charged with allegedly inflicting grievous bodily harm in what prosecutors said was an "unprovoked attack" on music producer Abraham Diaw with a tequila bottle in a London nightclub in 2023.

title.children: R&B star Chris Brown granted bail by UK court ahead of his world tour

image.altText: A man in a face mask holding up a sign reading "We Need Protection Equipment"

props.synopsis: More than 120 countries vote in favour to ensure that drugs, therapeutics and vaccines are globally accessible when the next pandemic hits.

title.children: WHO adopts 'pandemic agreement' in US absence

image.altText: A woman sitting at a desk with her eyes closed rubbing her temples

props.synopsis: Experts say symptoms of overwhelm are not always obvious but are important to address early on.

title.children: Signs of overwhelm not always obvious to those experiencing them, experts say
